data.partBlankContent: High-level languages are usually problem-oriented. This me___ that mo__ ( b__ not a__ ) high-level languages a__ written t_ solve prob____ in spec____ areas. data.fullContent: High-level languages are usually problem-oriented. This means that most ( but not all ) high-level languages are written to solve problems in specific areas. As a result there are lots of different high-level languages available to the programmer - some sources on the Internet list over 2,000 of them. This can make the process of selecting the most suitable language a daunting task.
data.answer: 高级语言通常是面向问题的。这意味着大多数(但不是所有)高级语言是为解决特定领域的问题而编写的。因此，有许多不同的高级语言可供程序员使用——因特网上的一些资源列出了超过2000种。这使得选择最合适的语言成为一项艰巨的任务。
